note:
Queenly 将自己视为正装的“StockX”，但在奢侈品转售市场上占有一席之地。这家初创公司让消费者在平台上列出他们用过的衣服——无论是婚礼、舞会还是选美——以折扣价出售给其他人。然后，当一件衣服售出时，卖家会赚取标价的 80% 左右，而买家则会得到一件无论如何都不会穿过的独特衣服。在一份声明中，A16z 的 Chan 表示，她亲身体验了“正装市场在技术上的独特性，但服务不足。”这位投资者指出，合身程度不那么重要，因为人们通常依赖于变化，但独特性很重要。她还赞扬了 Queenly 联合创始人 Trisha Bantigue 和 Kathy Zhou 在选美上的经验，这些经验已经进入最终产品。果然，联合创始人将大量精力投入到一种旨在帮助买家找到最适合他们的衣服的算法上，其搜索功能比零售店和 Poshmark 等竞争对手更能包括尺寸和肤色。 “这些只是我们知道的一些事情，因为我们是女性，我们知道如何为女性打造这种产品，”周在之前的一次采访中说。 “与如果这是一位男性创始人相反，他们不会知道这甚至是女性会寻找的东西。”转售市场面临着自身的挑战，其中最大的挑战通常是质量保证。对于价格在 300 美元或以下的连衣裙，Queenly 会获得状况证明照片，然后允许卖家直接发货给买家。价值 300 美元以上的连衣裙由公司自己处理，质量保证团队会更仔细地检查连衣裙的状况。 Queenly 于 2021 年冬季从 Y Combinator 毕业，当时正值冠状病毒大流行。尽管没有面对面的活动，但联合创始人表示，由于 Zoom 婚礼、Twitch 选美和远离社交的毕业典礼，他们的销售额达到了 50 万。 Queenly 也有一些小型化装企业，他们正在寻找一种数字解决方案来吸引 ubuyers，在网站上列出他们的库存。这一增长帮助这家初创公司在仍处于加速器阶段的时候筹集了 80 万美元，从包括 Stitch Fix 前首席运营官 Mike Smith、优步前首席技术官 Thuan Pham 和 Samsclub.com 和 Walmart.com 前首席运营官 Kelly Thompson 在内的投资者那里获得了 80 万美元。该公司随后以 230 万美元完成了第一轮种子轮融资，并吸引了 Dragon Capital 和其他投资者。
现在，三个月后，Queenly 将种子轮融资扩大了几百万。该公司拒绝透露其新的估值或销量，但确实表示，Queenly 平台上的连衣裙数量已从 2 月份的 50,000 件增加到现在的 7 月份的 60,000 件。根据《福布斯》杂志，Queenly 还与美国小姐组织建立了合作伙伴关系，这将通过参赛者将他们的衣服上传到平台来帮助扩大其足迹。当然，连衣裙并不是销售额的同义词——但如果有数百万人，这家初创公司可能有能力将这种影响转化为真正的美元。
note_en:
Queenly sees itself as a “StockX” for formalwear, but has its own hold on the resale market for luxury goods. The startup gets consumers to list their used dresses – whether it be from weddings, proms, or pageants – on the platform to sell at a discounted price to others. Sellers then make about 80% of the listed price when a dress is sold, while buyers get a unique dress that wouldn’t have been worn gain anyways.
  In a statement, A16z’s Chan said that she experienced “firsthand how unique but underserved the formalwear market is by technology.” The investor noted how fit is less important because people often rely on alterations, but uniqueness matters. She also credited the experience that the Queenly co-founders Trisha Bantigue and Kathy Zhou both have at pageants, which has made its way into the end-product.
 Sure enough, the co-founders have put much of their energy into an algorithm designed to help buyers find the best dress for them, with search capabilities that are meant to be more inclusive of size and skin color than competitors like retail stores and Poshmark.
 “These are just some things that we know because we’re women, and we know how to build this product for women,” Zhou said in a previous interview. “As opposed to if this was a male founder, they would not know that that would even be something that women would search for.”
 The resale marketplace comes with its own challenges, the biggest of which can often be quality assurance. For dresses priced at $300 or less, Queenly gets proof photos of condition and then allows sellers ship directly to buyers. Dresses above $300 are routed through the company’s own operation, where a qualiy assurance team more closely checks for the condition of the dress.
 Queenly  graduated from Y Combinator in Winter 2021, in the thick of the coronavirus pandemic. Despite the lack of in-person events, the co-founders said that they had half a million in sales, thanks to Zoom weddings, Twitch pageants and socially-distant graduations. Queenly also got small fancy dress businesses, looking for a digital solution to get ubuyers, to list their inventory on the site.
 The growth helped the startup raise while still in the accelerator, landing $800,000 from investors including Mike Smith, former COO of Stitch Fix, Thuan Pham, former CTO of Uber, and Kelly Thompson, former COO of Samsclub.com and Walmart.com. The company then closed the first bit of  its seed round at $2.3 million, bringing on Dragon Capital along with other investors.
 Now, three months later, Queenly has extended that seed round by a few million. The company declined to disclose its new valuation or sales volume, but did say that number of dresses on Queenly’s platform have grown from 50,000 in February to 60,000 now, in July. Queenly also landed a partnership,  per Forbes, with the Miss USA organization, which will help grow its footprint through contestants uploading their dresses to the platform. Of course, dresses aren’t synonymous with sales – but with millions more, the startup could be equipped to turn that reach into real dollars.
title: Queenly 的正装市场获得数百万美元的融资，由 A16z 领投
title_en: Queenly’s marketplace for formalwear gets millions in round led by A16z

note:
如果你是科技创业生态系统的一部分——或者渴望成为——为什么你不一头扎进三天，专注于建立和扩大成功创业公司所需的艺术和科学？听听三位过去的与会者如何评价他们的 Disrupt 体验。 Disrupt 是一个很好的甜蜜点，而且非常有价值，对于任何处于创意阶段的人来说，一直到筹集到一些天使资金。沉浸在音高甲板拆解和 VC 演示文稿中。他们会告诉你他们在寻找什么，是什么激励他们，是什么促使他们联系你开会。而这正是每个筹集资金的初创公司都需要知道的。 — Repositax 首席执行官迈克尔·麦卡锡 (Michael McCarthy)。 “TechCrunch 创造了一个伟大的场所，将创业生态系统中的所有不同的人聚集在一起。这是一个新的创业公司可以展示的地方，与会者可以向顶级行业专家学习，谁知道呢？有一天，他们可能会成为在 Disrupt 舞台上发言的人。总的来说，这是一个很棒的活动。” — JC Bodson，Arbitrage Technologies 的创始人兼首席执行官 “我在 Disrupt 建立的联系提供了长期利益。愿意投入资金的投资者、提供技术专长的工程师和制造商来帮助我简化流程。培养这些关系将帮助我发展我的公司和我的底线。” — Felicia Jackson，CPRWrap 的发明者和创始人。 Disrupt 是学习、联系、协作和密切关注快速变化趋势的地方。这只是我们拥有的及时主题和世界级专家的一个例子。不要忘记查看议程。拯救世界：COVID-19 改变了一切。它不仅威胁到我们个人的健康和福祉，而且还震动了全球的行业和经济。 COVID-19 疫苗也是如此。听听 BioNTech 联合创始人兼首席执行官 Ugur Sahin 与辉瑞一起快速开发世界上最受欢迎的疫苗的过程，以及基于 mRNA 的疗法的长期潜力。 Sahin 将与 Mayfield Fund 的 Ursheet Parikh 一起讨论初创公司在这个快速发展的行业中的下一步发展。专业提示：我们将在 Disrupt 之前添加新的演讲者、活动和折扣 - 注册更新，这样您就不会错过。
TechCrunch Disrupt 2021 将于 9 月 21 日至 23 日举行，但节省大量资金的时间将在本周结束。在 7 月 30 日晚上 11 点 59 分（太平洋时间）交易到期之前，在此处购买您的早鸟通行证。贵公司是否有兴趣赞助或参展 Disrupt 2021？填写此表格，联系我们的赞助销售团队。
note_en:
And if you’re part of the tech startup ecosystem — or aspire to be — why the heck wouldn’t you dive headlong into three days dedicated to the art and science required to build and scale successful startups? Just listen to what three past attendees said about their Disrupt experience.
 Disrupt is a great sweet spot, and highly valuable, for anyone in the idea stage all the way through to having raised some angel money. Soak up the pitch deck teardowns and the VC presentations. They’re telling you what they’re looking for, what motivates them, what pushes them to contact you for a meeting. And that’s exactly what every startup raising capital needs to know. — Michael McCarthy, CEO, Repositax.
  “TechCrunch has created a great venue that brings together all the different people within the startup ecosystem. It’s a place where new startups can present, attendees can learn from top industry experts and who knows? One day they might be the person speaking on the Disrupt stage. It’s a great event overall.” — JC Bodson, founder and CEO of Arbitrage Technologies
 “The connections I made at Disrupt offer long-term benefits. Investors willing to put forth capital, engineers offering tech expertise and manufacturers to help me streamline. Fostering these relationships will help me grow my company and my bottom line.” — Felicia Jackson, inventor and founder of CPRWrap.
 Disrupt is the place to be to learn, connect, collaborate and keep tabs on rapidly changing trends. Here’s just one example of the timely topics and world-class experts we have on tap. Don’t forget to  check out the agenda.
 Saving the World: COVID-19 changed everything. It not only threatened our individual health and wellbeing, but it also shook industries and economies across the globe. The same could be said about the COVID-19 vaccines. Hear from BioNTech Cofounder and CEO, Ugur Sahin on the process of rapidly developing the world’s most sought-after vaccine, alongside Pfizer, and the long-term potential of mRNA-based therapies. Sahin will be joined by Ursheet Parikh of Mayfield Fund to discuss what’s next for startups in this rapidly evolving industry.
 Pro Tip: We’ll add new speakers, events and discounts in the run up to Disrupt —  sign up for updates so you don’t miss out.

title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2021 通行证的早鸟优惠将于本周结束

note:
Box Inc. 正在通过添加一项重要的新功能来构建其内容云。该公司今天表示，它正在推出 Box Sign，这是 Box 中的一种原生电子签名功能，将使用户能够以电子方式签署合同并请求他人签名。 Box 表示，Box Sign 支持无限签名，并带有一组强大的应用程序编程接口，使企业能够完全在云中实现协议的现代化和管理。 Box Sign 功能是通过该公司今年早些时候以 5500 万美元收购荷兰初创公司 SignRequest BV 而实现的。 Box 首席执行官 Aaron Levie 在接受采访时告诉 SiliconANGLE，在 COVID-19 大流行期间，电子签名是其客户最需要的功能。由于大多数企业被迫在线开展业务，人们无法再面对面地签署合同和交易。 “越来越多的交易正在从纸质流程转移到云端，”Levie 说。 “但是现有的解决方案存在问题。它们成本太高，分散且存在安全问题。” Box Sign 旨在解决所有三个问题。它与 Box 原生集成，这意味着不再存在碎片化，客户无需支付额外费用即可使用它。这些功能甚至可以通过 Box for Salesforce 集成提供，因此可以从 Salesforce 内部生成和创建保密协议、合同等。该公司表示，至于安全性，Box Sign 继承了 Box 坚如磐石的安全性和合规性。
“这是我们多年来所做的最重要的新产品，”Levie 说。 Box Sign 功能包括向任何人发送和请求签名的能力，无论他们是否使用 Box，用于常见可重复流程（如 NDA）的模板，以及跟踪工具和电子邮件提醒和通知。 Box 表示，从今天开始，部分客户可以使用 Box Sign，其他用户将在未来几个月内看到它。 ZK Research 首席分析师 Zeus Kerravala 表示：“Box 的方法不同，因为它考虑了电子签名的生命周期，其中包括实际签名以及上游和下游流程。” “随着企业采用电子签名，重要的是将其视为整个文档管理流程的一部分，而不是孤立地完成。” Box Sign 功能帮助 Box 构建它喜欢称之为“内容云”的东西，它可以被认为是管理所有企业文档和文书工作的基础设施。借助 Box Content Cloud，该公司旨在通过增加关键自动化和安全功能的多合一服务取代分散的遗留系统，例如网络存储和文档和文件管理工具。 “我们正在构建一个内容云，帮助客户在单一架构中管理内容的整个生命周期，”Levie 说。 “所以你会看到我们投资于所有这些支柱。”为此，Box 宣布了一项名为 Enterprise Plus 的新订阅计划，该计划从今天开始可用。 Levie 说，它是迄今为止最高的级别，包括所有主要的附加组件。它将 Box 的基本功能与 Box Shield、Box Governance、Box Relay、Box Platform 和新的 Box Sign 捆绑在一起。除此之外，Enterprise Plus 客户将能够直接从 Salesforce 内发送无限数量的文档进行签名。
Levie 表示，他认为 Box Enterprise 可能会看到一些强劲的动力，并指出该公司最近看到了自去年第四季度以来的“增长重新加速”，超过 10 万美元的交易显着增长。他还指出了混合工作的趋势，在这种趋势中，人们将继续花费大量时间远程工作，而在办公室的时间有限。 “新的病毒变种和疫苗接种不足意味着混合工作将持续很长一段时间，”Levie 说。 “我们认为内容在混合工作中扮演着如此重要的角色，它将成为未来混合工作的主要组成部分。”加入我们的 Cube 俱乐部和 Cube 活动专家社区，表达您对我们使命的支持。加入社区，其中包括 Amazon Web Services，即将成为 Amazon.com 首席执行官 Andy Jassy、戴尔科技公司创始人兼首席执行官迈克尔戴尔、英特尔首席执行官 Pat Gelsinger 以及更多名人和专家。我们将于 6 月 16 日举行第二次云创业展示会。单击此处加入免费且开放的 Startup Showcase 活动。
note_en:
Box Inc. is building out its content cloud with the addition of an important new capability.
 The company said today it’s rolling out Box Sign, a native e-signature capability within Box that will give users the ability to electronically sign contracts and request signatures from others.
 Box said Box Sign enables unlimited signatures and comes with a robust set of application programming interfaces that will enable businesses to modernize and manage their agreements entirely in the cloud.
 The Box Sign capability was made possible through the company’s  $55 million acquisition of Dutch startup SignRequest BV earlier this year.
 Box Chief Executive Aaron Levie told SiliconANGLE in an interview that e-signatures were the most-demanded feature from its customers during the COVID-19 pandemic. With most enterprises forced to do business online, people couldn’t meet face-to-face anymore to sign contracts and deals.
 “So many more transactions are moving from paper-based processes to the cloud,” Levie said. “But there are problems with existing solutions. They cost too much, they’re fragmented and there are security problems.”
 Box Sign is aimed at doing away with all three problems. It’s natively integrated with Box, meaning no more fragmentation and customers don’t have to pay extra to use it. The capabilities are even made available through the Box for Salesforce integration, so it’s possible to generate and create non-disclosure agreements, contracts and the like from within Salesforce. As for security, Box Sign inherits Box’s rock-solid security and compliance profile, the company said.
 “This is the most significant new product we’ve done in a number of years,” Levie said.
 Box Sign features include the ability to send and request signatures from anyone, regardless of if they use Box or not, templates for common repeatable processes such as NDAs, plus tracking tools and email reminders and notifications.
 Box said Box Sign is available to a subset of its customers starting today, and the rest of its users will see it in the coming months.
 “Box’s approach is different as it thinks about the lifecycle of the e-signature which includes the actual signature but also the upstream and downstream processes,” said Zeus Kerravala, principal analyst with ZK Research. “As businesses adopt e-signatures, it’s important to think of it as part of the overall document management process versus something done in isolation.”
  The Box Sign capability helps Box to build out what it  likes to call its “Content Cloud,” which can be thought of as an infrastructure for managing all of a businesses’ documentation and paper work. With Box Content Cloud, the company is aiming to displace fragmented legacy systems such as network storage and document and file management tools with an all-in-one service that adds in key automation and security capabilities.
 “We’re building out a content cloud that helps customers manage the entire lifecycle of content in a single architecture,” Levie said. “So you’ll see us invest in all these pillars.”
 In line with that, Box has announced a new subscription plan called Enterprise Plus that’s available starting today. It’s highest tier yet that includes all of its major add-ons, Levie said. It bundles Box’s basic capabilities with  Box Shield,  Box Governance,  Box Relay, Box Platform and the new Box Sign. In addition to that, Enterprise Plus customers will be able to send an unlimited number of documents for signature directly from within Salesforce.
 Levie said he believes Box Enterprise is likely to see some solid traction, noting that the company recently saw a “reacceleration of growth” from the fourth quarter of last year, with deals above $100,000 growing significantly. He also pointed to the trend of hybrid work, in which people will continue to spend many hours working remotely with only limited time spent in offices.
 “New virus variants and inadequate vaccination means hybrid work will continue for quite some time,” Levie said. “We think content plays such an important role in hybrid work, and it will be a major fixture of what hybrid work looks like in the future.”
   Show your support for our mission by joining our Cube Club and Cube Event Community of experts. title: 在今年早些时候以 5500 万美元收购 SignRequest 之后，Box 推出了 Box Sign，它允许用户以电子方式签署合同并请求签名
title_en: Box rolls out Box Sign, which lets users electronically sign contracts and request signatures, following its $55M acquisition of SignRequest earlier this year

note:
可以调整形状的曲面成像器可能有许多有价值的应用，例如，有助于开发更先进的医学成像工具和相机。然而，大多数现有的柔性弯曲成像器要么与可调焦面不兼容，要么只能捕获具有低分辨率和像素填充因子的图像。休斯顿大学和科罗拉多大学博尔德分校的研究人员最近设计并创造了一种具有高像素填充因子的弯曲自适应成像仪。发表在《自然电子》杂志上的一篇论文中介绍了这种新型成像器，它是通过使用一种称为保形增材印章印刷的技术将具有剪纸设计的超薄硅光电像素阵列转移到弯​​曲表面上制造的。 “基于弯曲成像传感器的相机，例如由视网膜和晶状体组成的类人眼球，在许多关键应用中具有广阔的前景，”进行这项研究的研究人员之一于存江告诉 Phys.org。 “尽管如此，此类相机的开发面临许多技术挑战，例如与高像素填充因子和形状可调性相关的技术挑战，这两个功能对于捕捉无光学像差的清晰图像是必不可少的。” Yu 和他的同事最近研究的目标是克服之前在尝试开发弯曲和形状自适应成像器时遇到的问题。与传统数码相机相比，事实上，弯曲成像传感器通常需要多个复杂的镜头组合才能拍摄清晰和高分辨率的图像。研究人员开发的弯曲成像仪的灵感来自人类眼球的形状。就像人的眼球一样，其实弯曲的相机应该是由弯曲的、形状自适应的成像传感器阵列和镜头组成的。 “使用传统或现有技术创建弯曲的成像器可能非常具有挑战性，”Yu 解释说。 “我们的曲线成像仪的关键新颖之处在于新颖、可靠和稳健的制造技术，名为保形增材印章 (CAS) 印刷，这是我的研究小组发明的。”首先，Yu 和他的同事使用成熟的微加工工艺，按照 kirikami 设计（即日本折纸艺术的一种变体，也包括剪纸以创建 3D对象，而不仅仅是折叠它）。随后，研究人员使用一种称为 CAS 打印的技术来创建具有所需形状的弯曲成像器。 “镜头的焦距和成像传感器（或成像器）的曲率可以相应地进行调整，以实现自适应光学聚焦并减少远近物体成像的像差，这甚至超过了人眼的能力，因为人类视网膜没有提供类似水平的可调性，”于说。
弯曲成像器在拉伸前的填充因子为 78%，并且可以在 30% 的双轴应变下保持其电气性能。未来，它可能有许多有价值的应用，例如帮助开发更先进、性能更好的内窥镜、视网膜假体、人工复眼相机和鱼眼镜头。 “我们的工作为实现具有高填充因子的弯曲、形状可调的自适应/可调成像器铺平了道路，以保证高质量和低光学像差的成像捕获，”于说。 “我们未来的研究将致力于开发其他高性能成像传感器像素和阵列，以及上述设备。”更多信息：基于带有剪纸设计的印刷光电像素的弯曲形状自适应成像器。自然电子（2021）。 DOI：10.1038/s41928-021-00600-1
note_en:
Curved imagers that can adjust their shape could have many valuable applications, for instance, aiding the development of more advanced medical imaging tools and cameras. Most existing flexible curvy imagers, however, are either not compatible with tunable focal surfaces or can only capture images with low resolutions and pixel fill factors.    Researchers at University of Houston and University of Colorado-Boulder have recently designed and created a curvy and  -adaptive imager with high pixel fill factors. The new imager, presented in a paper published in  Nature Electronics, was fabricated by transferring an array of ultrathin silicon optoelectronic pixels with a kirigami design onto curvy surfaces, using a technique known as conformal additive stamp printing.
  "Curvy imaging sensor-based cameras, such as a human-like eyeball composed of retina and a lens, hold great promise for many critical applications," Cunjiang Yu, one of the researchers who carried out the study, told  Phys.org. "Nonetheless, the development of such cameras entails many technical challenges, for instance associated with high pixel fill factor and shape tunability, two features that are necessary to capture clear images without optical aberration."
  The objective of the recent study by Yu and his colleagues was to overcome the   previously encountered when trying to develop curvy and shape-adaptive imagers. In contrast with conventional digital cameras, in fact, curvy imaging sensors typically require multiple and complex lens combinations to take clear and high-resolution  .
  The curvy imager developed by the researchers is inspired by the shape of human eyeballs. Just like a human eyeball, in fact, curvy cameras should be made of a curvy and shape adaptive imaging sensor array and a lens.
   "Creating curvy imagers using conventional or existing technologies can be highly challenging," Yu explained. "The key novelty of our curvy imager is the novel, reliable and robust manufacturing technology, named conformal additive stamp (CAS) printing, which was invented by my research group."
  First, Yu and his colleagues used mature microfabrication processes to create a planar shaped, very thin 32 x 32-pixel imaging sensor array, following a kirikami design (i.e., a variation of the Japanese art of origami that also involves cutting paper to create 3D objects, rather than just folding it). Subsequently, the researchers used a technique called CAS printing to create curvy imagers with desired shapes.
    "The focal length of the lens and the curvature of the imaging sensor (or imager) can be tuned accordingly, to achieve adaptive optical focus and reduce aberration for imaging far and near objects, which even exceeds the capability of the human eye, since the human retina does not offer a similar level of tunability," Yu said.
  The curvy imager exhibits a fill factor of 78% before stretching and can maintain its electrical performance under a 30% biaxial strain. In the future, it could have a number of valuable applications, for instance aiding the development of more advanced and better performing endoscopes, retinal prostheses,  , artificial compound eye cameras and fisheye cameras.
  "Our work paves way to achieve curvy, shape tunable adaptive/tunable imager with high   fill factor to guarantee imaging capture with high quality and low optical aberration," Yu said. "Our future research will be aimed at developing other high-performance imaging sensor pixels and arrays, and the aforementioned   devices."        More information:												Curvy, shape-adaptive imagers based on printed optoelectronic pixels with a kirigami design.  Nature Electronics(2021).  DOI: 10.1038/s41928-021-00600-1
title: 弯曲的自适应成像传感器改善图像，保留更多像素
title_en: Curvy adaptable imaging sensor improves image, retains more pixels
